subject: Psychology
title: Normative vs Informational Influence
description: A short lesson to help you apply Normative vs Informational Influence.

hook.text: You laugh at a joke you don't understand because everyone else is laughing. That's one type of social pressure.

buildup.text: Normative influence is conforming to be liked or accepted. You go along to fit in.

discovery.text: Informational influence is conforming because you think others know better. You go along to be correct.

twist.text: Normative influence changes public behavior but not private beliefs. Informational influence changes actual beliefs.

climax.text: Understanding which type of influence is at work helps you decide when conformity is wise and when it's mere pressure.

punchline.text: Are you agreeing to fit in, or because you're convinced?

quiz.question: What is normative influence?
options: Conforming to be liked or accepted by a group
Conforming because others seem to know better
Refusing to follow any group norms
